page.title: 12LANGDON COURT
page.content: {In 1066 according to Domesday Book,the {owners of Langdon manor were the {Saxons Heche and Goda.}The next owner {was a Norman knight called Waldin. Although it is only 6 miles from Plymouth it could be 60 as the hotel is surrounded by farms and woodland.It has{15 rooms to let all with private {bathroom and toilet,colour TV, tele- {phone and radio/alarm.}Mr and Mrs Cox and Mrs Barnes run the hotel. In the {cellar}there is a{well}in which a WW2 loaded colt revolver was found.There is also an entrance to{a secret pass- {age}there. Nobody has yet reached the end of this.In Tudor times it was pro- bably used as an{escape tunnel,}or it may have been a{drain.}We thought that it must have been used as a{hiding {place by smugglers.}For 300 years the {Calmady family}lived here(1570-1876). The Langdon estates were sold in 1927.
